meanings.definition: A person who testifies or provides evidence.
meanings.sent1: The attester in court shared what they saw.
meanings.sent2: The attester signed a document confirming the events.
meanings.sent3: The attester's testimony made everyone laugh in the courtroom.
meanings.sent4: Her honesty was an attester to her character.
meanings.sent5: The attester's words were like a beacon of truth in the trial.

meanings.definition: To affirm or certify the truth of something.
meanings.sent1: I will attester to the accuracy of the report.
meanings.sent2: She will attester that the information is correct.
meanings.sent3: He loves to attester to his friends' jokes.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors attestered the beauty of the painting.

meanings.definition: To serve as evidence or proof of something.
meanings.sent1: The fingerprints attestered his presence at the scene.
meanings.sent2: The contract will attester to the agreement between the parties.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing sink attestered to the forgetfulness of the chef.
meanings.sent4: The old photo attestered to the history of the building.
meanings.sent5: The footprints attestered the path taken by the hiker.
